parameters.name: code
parameters.description: The registration code obtained after starting authentication on the primary device

parameters.name: serviceProvider
parameters.description: The internal unique identifier associated with a Service Provider during on-boarding process.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The media type accepted by the client application. If specified it must always be application/json.

parameters.name: User-Agent
parameters.description: The user agent of the client application.

302.description: Redirect. The response contains a location redirect to continue the flow until reaching the MVPD login page.

400.description: Bad request. The request was invalid. Check the JSON-based error information provided in the response body.

401.description: Unauthorized. The access token is not valid, the client application needs to obtain a new one using the information from dynamic client registration process.

404.description: Not found. There is no authentication session found on Adobe Primetime Authentication backend.

405.description: Method not allowed.The client tried to use an HTTP methods that the specified resource doesn't allow.

500.description: Internal Server Error. Something is broken on Adobe Primetime Authentication services side. The JSON-based error information provided in the response body will explain further.

get.summary: Retrieve configuration for specific service provider
get.description: The Configuration API can be used to retrieve the configuration associated with a particular Service Provider.

parameters.name: profile
parameters.description: Provide profile id

parameters.name: serviceProvider
parameters.description: The internal unique identifier associated with a Service Provider during on-boarding process.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The authorization header containing OAuth2 access token obtained through dynamic client registration process.

parameters.name: AP-Device-Identifier
parameters.description: The application device identifier as described in AP-Device-Identifier.

parameters.name: X-Device-Info
parameters.description: Strongly recommended to use it always when the application's device platform allows to provide valid values explicitly.

parameters.name: X-Forwarded-For
parameters.description: The Streaming Device IP address. Must use it only for Server-to-Server implementations when the call is made by the Programmer Service and not the Streaming Device, while for Client-to-Server implementations, the Streaming Device IP address is implicitly sent.

parameters.name: AP-SDK-Identifier
parameters.description: The SDK identifier as specified in AP-SDK-Identifier. Must use it only by an Adobe Primetime Authentication SDK.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The media type accepted by the client application. If specified it must always be application/json.

parameters.name: User-Agent
parameters.description: The user agent of the client application.

post.summary: Retrieve authorization decisions using specific MVPD
post.description: In order to perform the preauthorization flow, a valid authenticated profile must be found in the backend for the specified MVPD. If there is no authenticated profile found in the backend for the specified MVPD, then a validation error is returned in the response body, as described in Public APIs - Error codes.

parameters.description: The internal unique identifier associated with an Identity Provider during on-boarding process.

get.summary: Initiate logout for all authenticated profiles of specific MVPD
get.description: The logout service performs the following: deletes the authenticated profiles found in the backend for the specific device, client application and specified MVPD returns a list of actions the client application must perform in order to finalize the logout flow for the authenticated profile with specified MVPD

parameters.name: mvpd
parameters.description: The internal unique identifier associated with an Identity Provider during on-boarding process.

parameters.name: redirectUrl
parameters.description: The final redirect url where the programmer application navigates to when the logout final is completed with the mvpd. This parameter needs to be included when the programmer application initiates the logout flow with the mvpd using the "url" attribute received in OneAPI logout response.

post.description: This endpoint returns a verification code which is essentially the authentication request. The format should follow the general rules of the OneAPI endpoints so it is a json-formatted body. For degraded integrations, return a json response indicating that the integration is degraded and the next call should be the one in /decisions endpoint.

parameters.description: The user agent of the client application.

mvpd.description: The MVPD identifier associated with the end-user's subscription.If device platform has limitations in providing a value, then the application will have to resume the authentication session later on and provide a valid value.

domainName.description: The originating domain of the application performing mvpd login.

redirectUrl.description: The url where the client application is redirected to when authentication is completed. The value must be URL encoded.

retrieveAuthorizeDecisionsForMvpdUsingPO.description: A list of resourceIds that identifies the content that might be accessible to a user and is recognized by MVPD authorization endpoints.
